class core.views.FormSetUpdateView(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: core.views.FormSetUserAllowedMixin, braces.views._access.LoginRequiredMixin, django.contrib.messages.views.SuccessMessageMixin, django.views.generic.base.View

Generic update view that uses a formset. This allows you to edit multiple forms of the same type on the same page.

get_queryset()[source]¶

Return the QuerySet that will be used to look up the object.

Note that this method is called by the default implementation of get_object and may not be called if get_object is overridden.

class core.views.FormSetUserAllowedMixin[source]¶

Bases: core.views.UserAllowedMixin

check_allowed()[source]¶

Allows access to a proposal based on the status of a Proposal and the position of the User. He can be: - in the ‘SECRETARY’ or ‘COMMISSION’ group - an applicant of this Proposal - a supervisor of this Proposal If the status of the Proposal is not in line with the status of the User, a PermissionDenied is raised.

class core.views.UserAllowedMixin[source]¶

get_object(queryset=None)[source]¶

Allows access to a proposal based on the status of a Proposal and the position of the User. He can be: - in the ‘SECRETARY’ or ‘COMMISSION’ group - an applicant of this Proposal - a supervisor of this Proposal If the status of the Proposal is not in line with the status of the User, a PermissionDenied is raised.

core.views.escape_ldap_input(string)[source]¶

This function escapes the user input such that all values are seen as text, not filter instructions.

TL;DR: prevents LDAP injection

Parameters:string (string) – The to be escaped string
Return string:The escaped string
core.views.format_user_info(lst)[source]¶

This will format a user object into a displayable format

core.views.success_url(self)[source]¶
core.views.user_search(query, page)[source]¶

This function searches through users for a given query. Page 1 will return registered users, or if there are none, LDAP users. Page 2 will return LDAP users.

The double behaviour of page 1 has to be this weird because of the way Select2 handles empty pages.

If a page returns LDAP users, or there is no LDAP connection available, we will mark the page as the last page.
